title: Mn(II)-Based MRI Contrast Agent Candidate for Vascular Imaging

reactions.text: PC2A-BP was prepared by alkylating the bis-methylcyanide-pyclen precursor, obtained by following the procedure of Kim et al., with commercially available 1-(chloromethyl)-4-phenylbenzene in the presence of N,N-diisopropylethylamine (DIPEA) base and KI. The product was then hydrolyzed in 6 M HCl and purified for analytical work by preparative high-pressure liquid chromatography (HPLC) to give the PC2A-BP chelator (Scheme 1).

The PC2A-BP ligand was prepared by alkylating the bis-methylcianide-pyclen precursor (3,9-bis(methylenenitrile)-3,6,9,15-tetraazabicyclo[9.3.l]-pentadecal(lS),ll,l3-triene 1) prepared by following the procedure of Kim et al. with the commercially available 4-phenylbenzyl chloride in the presence of Hüning’s base as follows: 150 mg (0,528 mmol) of bis-methylcianide-pyclen (1) was dissolved in 5 mL of dry acetonitrile under an Ar-protected atmosphere, and 0.185 mL (1.06 mmol) of Hüning’s base (DIPEA) as well as 45 mg (0.268 mmol) of KI was added to the solution. The reaction mixture was heated to 60 °C by using an oil bath, and 0.118 g (0.580 mmol) of 4-phenylbenzyl chloride dissolved in 5 mL of dry acetonitrile was added to the suspension dropwise during 3 h. The reaction mixture was stirred at the given temperature for 40 h and filtered, and the filtrate was evaporated to dryness under reduced pressure. The oily residue was redissolved in 10 mL of 12 M HCl, and the solution was refluxed for 25 h at 110 °C. The reaction mixture was then evaporated to dryness under reduced pressure, and the residue was redissolved in 4 mL of double distilled water. Separation via preparative HPLC (Figure S12) yielded PC2A-BP as an off white solid upon freeze-drying the combined fractions containing the product.

The PC2A-BP ligand was prepared by alkylating the bis-methylcianide-pyclen precursor (3,9-bis(methylenenitrile)-3,6,9,15-tetraazabicyclo[9.3.l]-pentadecal(lS),ll,l3-triene 1) prepared by following the procedure of Kim et al. with the commercially available 4-phenylbenzyl chloride in the presence of Hüning’s base as follows: 150 mg (0,528 mmol) of bis-methylcianide-pyclen (1) was dissolved in 5 mL of dry acetonitrile under an Ar-protected atmosphere, and 0.185 mL (1.06 mmol) of Hüning’s base (DIPEA) as well as 45 mg (0.268 mmol) of KI was added to the solution. The reaction mixture was heated to 60 °C by using an oil bath, and 0.118 g (0.580 mmol) of 4-phenylbenzyl chloride dissolved in 5 mL of dry acetonitrile was added to the suspension dropwise during 3 h. The reaction mixture was stirred at the given temperature for 40 h and filtered, and the filtrate was evaporated to dryness under reduced pressure. The oily residue was redissolved in 10 mL of 12 M HCl, and the solution was refluxed for 25 h at 110 °C. The reaction mixture was then evaporated to dryness under reduced pressure, and the residue was redissolved in 4 mL of double distilled water. Separation via preparative HPLC (Figure S12) yielded PC2A-BP as an off white solid upon freeze-drying the combined fractions containing the product.

The PC2A-BP ligand was prepared by alkylating the bis-methylcianide-pyclen precursor (3,9-bis(methylenenitrile)-3,6,9,15-tetraazabicyclo[9.3.l]-pentadecal(lS),ll,l3-triene 1) prepared by following the procedure of Kim et al. with the commercially available 4-phenylbenzyl chloride in the presence of Hüning’s base as follows: 150 mg (0,528 mmol) of bis-methylcianide-pyclen (1) was dissolved in 5 mL of dry acetonitrile under an Ar-protected atmosphere, and 0.185 mL (1.06 mmol) of Hüning’s base (DIPEA) as well as 45 mg (0.268 mmol) of KI was added to the solution. The reaction mixture was heated to 60 °C by using an oil bath, and 0.118 g (0.580 mmol) of 4-phenylbenzyl chloride dissolved in 5 mL of dry acetonitrile was added to the suspension dropwise during 3 h. The reaction mixture was stirred at the given temperature for 40 h and filtered, and the filtrate was evaporated to dryness under reduced pressure. The oily residue was redissolved in 10 mL of 12 M HCl, and the solution was refluxed for 25 h at 110 °C. The reaction mixture was then evaporated to dryness under reduced pressure, and the residue was redissolved in 4 mL of double distilled water. Separation via preparative HPLC (Figure S12) yielded PC2A-BP as an off white solid upon freeze-drying the combined fractions containing the product.

For the calculation of H+ concentrations from the measured pH values, a 0.02 M HCl (0.15 M NaCl) solution was titrated with standardized NaOH based on the method proposed by Irving et al.. The value of Kw (ion product of water) was obtained from the same titration (pH = 11.5–12.0).
